title: M.N. inserted his own comments because problematic passages in the original had been misinterpreted. It is at least possible, though Alexandra Barratt queries such a possibility, that M.N. was also aware of Margarete Porete’s condemnation as a heretic, which would provide a further reason for his care in distinguishing addition from original: see the Appendix by Colledge and Guarnieri

. In any case, the extreme unconventionality of Porete’s text (and also the fact that it was by a woman) would make circumspection advisable, especially if the translation were made in the fifteenth century in England
